Frame.Nav: Redesigned linkage for improved sightlines and increased productivity.
Increased bucket rollback improves productivity through maximum material retention. Level lift is achieved throughout the entire lift/dump cycle.
New lighting package with lamps mounted high on cab and at operator level improves illumination to forward work zone.

Nav.SubTitle: Better line of sight to attachments

Frame.Nav: Redesign of attachment area provides improved operator view of hydraulic coupler, bucket, or other attachments, such as fork. This results in improved productivity.
Bucket penetrates material easily for heaped buckets every time.
Angled steps make climbing into the cab easier for reduced operator fatigue.
Low-profile routing of hoses to conform closer to loader arms further improves operator's forward visibility.
Limited-slip axles automatically transfer power from the wheel that is slipping to the wheel that is gripping.

Cab features low interior noise levels; standard, low-effort joystick control for all boom functions; forward/neutral/reverse quick shuttle switch for easy loader operation; flat glass to eliminate distortion and is easily replaced; uninterrupted sightline to right-hand control switches; adjustable steering console; dual brake pedals, and optional Air Ride seat and air conditioning.
Latching pins for hydraulic coupler now easier to see from operator's seat.
Outboard planetary and wet disc brakes provide ease of serviceability and machine stability because the weight is outside the frame rather than inside.
Remote drains accessible from ground level, allow controlled removal of hydraulic oil, engine oil and coolant by attaching drain hoses.
Power Shift transmission automatically matches the gear to the application. The transmission also can be operated in the manual mode.
Reduced-profile counterweight swings within standard turning radius of tires and provides better stabilization during carry operations.
One-piece, electronically controlled flip-up hood allows easy access to all daily maintenance checkpoints.
Optional exterior mirrors improve operator visibility and safety. Interior cab mirrors are standard equipment.
Tail lights set in hood, above counterweight, for improved visibility on the jobsite.
Contoured hood provides industry-leading rear visibility.

Tier II certified engine produces more power on demand with lower emissions. Filters easily accessible from ground level; mounted vertically for easy spin on/off. Sight guages provide easy view of fluid levels in transmission and hydraulic tank.

Cube-shaped, mid-mount cooling module constantly supplies clean air to all coolers, thereby increasing cooling efficiency, reducing fluid breakdown and extending component life. Raised panel allows easy access to coolers. Reversible, hydraulically driven fan purges debris from
all coolers.
Steering cylinders mounted high in chassis to protect against debris and extend component life.
Improved productivity with optional Ride Control. This increases material retention, reduces shock load on the machine, and increases operator comfort.
Lube for Life driveline exemplifies Case commitment to reduce level of maintenance needed on all its construction machines.
